oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Reemay sample from the DuPont Plant
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: A sample or Reemay, a non-woven fabric of synthetic fiber devloped by DuPont and manufactured at the Old Hickory factory. The U.S. Army purchased thousands of acres in Hadley's Bend in 1917 for the creation of a smokeless gunpowder plant to be operated by the DuPont Powder Works. The Powder Works closed in 1919 with the end of WWI. However, DuPont returned and bought the property in 1928 and began the manufacture of Reemay, Rayon and Cellophane.
